text:
5/VI/17 - sample from 33cl bottle @ LIBF 2017 (Leuven) - BB: n/a (2017-753) Thanks to the Belgian RB crew for sharing todayÂ’s beers!
Clear dark brown beer, small creamy beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: malty, lots of dried fruits, chocolate, bit sugary. MF: soft carbon, medium body, alcoholic mouth feeling. MF: bit sweet, alcohol, soft roast, lots of chocolate, caramel, bit malty. Aftertaste: very bitter finish, hoppy, alcohol, soft roast. Might have had a bit more dry hopping, missing some fruity hoppy smell.

F: medium size, tanned, good retention.
C: dark, opaque.
A: malty, passion fruits, tangerine, orange, roasted tones, chocolate, cocoa, vinous.
T: chocolate, tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, decent bitterness, coffee, dark fruits, full complex body, lower carbonation, batch 0428, bottled 10/04/17, BB 10/04/19, very good almost great, enjoyed, 33cl bottle from LIBF 2017 in Leuven.

Restrained citrus pine aroma in an inky black pour. Hop forward balance with fruity body and sustained bitter finish. Totally hides its strength - which is more a double BIPA to my mind. Dangerously delicious.

330ml bottle. Pours translucent black with little head. Orange, grapefruit, smoke, strong blackcurrant, molasses. Flavour goes a bit harder on the smoke and alcohol, leaving it quite unbalanced. Nice.

Bottle sample @ LIBFÂ’17, thanks to the RB-InBev Belgian crew for the share. 
Brune/cuivrÃ©e, col fin beige.
ArÃ´me est maltÃ©, caramel, belles notes de cafÃ© enrobÃ©es dÂ’effluves de chocolat, le tout avec un rÃ©tro mettant le bouquet houblonnÃ© bien en avant, pas mal dÂ’agrumes, c-hops style.
Palais est rondement bien menÃ© avec une trÃ¨s belle balances des malts et houblons, retrouve lÂ’effet torrÃ©fiÃ©, cafÃ© avec une pointe de moka et chocolat, le tout confondu sur de belles saveurs dÂ’houblons tropicaux, amÃ©ricains ou NZ.
Black with thin head. Aroma and flavour have plenty of dark malts and chocolate. Nicely bitter. Espresso aftertaste.

33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de biÃ¨res. Robe sombre avec fine mousse brune. Au nez on est sur une BIPA avec du pamplemousse. La premiÃ¨re gorgÃ©e est trÃ¨s lÃ©gÃ¨re et parfumÃ©e. Puis le cÃ´tÃ© IS arrive doucement avec un beau mariage de malt torrÃ©fiÃ©, un peu de rÃ©glisse et un final tout en amertume qui dure trÃ¨s longtemps. Un Ã©quilibre trÃ¨s sympathique.

Bottle. Pours black. Aroma of roast malt, chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Moderate sweet and roast bitter taste. Very much imperial stout like, found a little fruit hoppiness at the back after letting it linger in the mouth. What ever the style itÂ’s pretty damn nice.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours dark, black in glass, thick dense brown head. Smell of dark malts, citrus hops, grapes, hints of pine, roast and dark malts. Moderate sweet, fruity and citrusy, some roast, chocolate and coffee, alot of nice flavors, dark malts. Medium bitter, resin tail. Quite nice BIPA

Bottled. Pours clear deep brown with a small beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, citrus, pine and chocolate. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice BIPA. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Tried in a bottle from crafty bottle. Lincoln. This is batch 0386 and 9.2%. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma fruity, liquorice, and toffee. Taste has rich and deep roasted malt and pithy citrus. Rich and full arming body.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 Keg @Sr. LÃºpulo, GijÃ³n. 10-12-2016.
Quite hoppy, viscous palated. Dark with tan hea. Mdoerate bitter, little roasty and coffee, Robust, intensively hopped.

Cask Third of a Pint at PigÂ’s Ear Beer Festival, London, Dec 2015 - Very Dark Brown in colour. Slight tan head. Malty; roasty malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, some liquorice; includes "honey and molasses". Fruity; dark fruits, some citrus. Spicy. Hoppy; good piney hops. Bittersweet roast chocolate malty balanced by piney hops. Bitter dry finish. Liked this. Not a Black IPA, but it is a Nice hoppy Impy Stout! (2015-12-03)

Tap.
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Black.
T: Roasted malt, hops, bitter, chocolate.

ItÂ’s sweet, moderately bitter, with a great full body and a long nice finish. Aromas of roasted malts, syrup, a bit of smoked sausage, and bitterness like chocolate or coffee in the aftertaste. Drinks quite easy despite the amount of alcohol. I wouldnÂ’t recognize this as a Black IPA, but itÂ’s a great beer in general.
On tap at MurphyÂ’s Law. Dark brown with a tan head. Notes of chocolate, pine resin, bitter liquor, dark malts. Medium body and carbonation and a hoppy finish.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, dark fruit, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange, dark fruit, liquorice and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Super balanced between an IPA and a Stout. Great appearance and taste. Has no real flaws anywhere to be honest. Great for its style.

Draft 0.15l at Bierproeflokaal In De Wildeman Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 21.09.2016. Taste with Vlada Ciaone. Pour it dark color with medium white head. Aroma of roasted malt, pine, chocolate. Taste sweet malty feel, pine, English carachter I liked it, chocolate, bitterish finish, nice balanced, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation.

33cl bottle from ales by mail. Color is dark with light touches of red. Head is thin and brown. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Medium dry body. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, hops, fresh leaves, liquorice, pineapple, dried fruits, pepper.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours black with a big thick creamy beige head. Nice fruity aroma with notes of pine. The taste starts hoppy with spice and pine increasing in the bitter finish. Nice underlying coffee and dark chocolate notes. Very creamy mouthfeel. Nice work.

Pours translucent black with medium beige head which dissipates quite quickly. Aromas of chocolate, coffee and alcohol with some citrus hops. Nose is definitely more on the imperial stout spectrum than other BIPAs. Smooth carbonation with oily mouth feel. Taste is quite piney hops which quickly change to chocolate and roasted malt. This seems to be more of a mix of IPA and stout than black IPA but I like it! Not as light as an IPA but not as cloyingly sweet as an impy stout. Finish is medium to sweet with nice bitter finish and a little alcohol burn

On tap @ Brewda Â’16. The aroma has light roast, pine, tropical fruits, strawberries, citrus, hint of chocolate. Dark coloured beer with a medium, creamy, beige head. The taste is moderate bitter, has light roast bitterness, pine/resin, tropical fruits, citrus. Very mild, smooth palate. This is awesome.

Draught at Uiltje Bar. Hazy dark brown with a small tan head. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle sweet tones. Roasted malts, pine, caramel, coffee and spices. Good BIPA.

gedeeld met de boys onderweg naar Borefts 2016. Mooi inktzwart met een licht bruine kraag. De smaak en geurbeleving verloopt van cacao/chocolade tot aan zwarte bes. Mooie volle body en een fris bittere afdronk. Nice!

330ml bottle. Pours black with a thin but long lasting tan head. Aroma: hoppy, pine, chocolate, alcohol, dark fruit, coffee. Taste: Pretty much as the aroma, quite hoppy with a nice chocolate and coffee hit, dark fruits, liquorice, light sweetness from the malt. Medium body, soft carbonation, well balanced though may benefit from a bit more roasted malts, awesome beer though an instant favourite for me.

22.09.2016, tap @ In de Wildeman:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry foresty, dark malts, pine needles, moss, minerals, grass, bark, hay, alcohol, hops, dark sugar, hints of coffee. Taste is slightly sour-ish harsh roasted, weeds, dark malts, alcohol, harsh hops, pine needles, citrus peel, moss, leafs, dark sugar, minerals. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

10 cl. draft @ BillieÂ’s Bier Kafeteria. Black, deep mocha head that is mainly on the sides. Nose is licorice, herbal, thick syrup going to molasses with low blueberry&bramble but only a brief touch. taste is decent chocolate syrup, good amount of licorice, molasses, sugar, low herbal, faint bramble, molasses,... Really opens up when it gets a bit warmer, finish gets some lovely Sorachi Ace (presumed), nice cheesy hops, very nice, more mocha sweetness, less licorice, very interesting,... Body is very thick going to molasses, very interesting&fine beer.

Tap at the Birmingham Beer Bash 2016. Poured a clear dark brown with little life. The aroma is light floral hop, some fruit and alcohol. The flavour is moderate bitter with a dry, fruity, yeast, light sweet malt, alcohol palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord. Pitch black color, good offwhite foam. High aroma intensity; roasty , choclate , coffee, light hops , some leather and malt . Full body & high complexity . Some immediate sweetness- high balancing bitterness - balances well. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A bipa/impstout with a huge orange marmelade - almost Grand Marnier presence making me curious about what kind of hops had been used. Nose: slight alcohol fumes, herbal notes, hints of vermouth and lots of sweet oranges/orange marmelade getting really big in taste with only slight cocoa/chocolate and roast in the background. Also, this brew seems indestructible even after the rest had been left one night in the open bottle and not in the fridge. Flawless but imho more of a black dipa than a bipa/impstout.

Pours a cloudy, very deep brown body with a fairly large, creamy, brown head that is both long-lived and capable of decorating my glass with foam. Hoppy, malty, sweet and very strong aroma of roasted malt, tropical fruits and grapefruit, with coffee, herbs and sugars in the back. Very strong flavour of tropical fruits, grapefruit and roasted malt in the form of coffee and chocolate, and hints of ash in the back. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitter long-lasting finish. Very pleasant mouthfeel, with a full body, smooth texture and moderate carbonation. A very well crafted BIPA, with an excellent hops/malt balance! 
[33 cl bottle, batch 232, enjoyed 7 months after bottling, from Vinmonopolet Aker Brygge, Oslo]

Bottle 33cl, a dark beer with medium copper head, medium duration. Nose is on hop resin, licorice, dark malt and dark caramel. Aroma is on dark chocolate, smooth coffee and mocha, hops resin, floral and grassy touch, some candied fruits. Robust body, quite sweet, medium to hight bitterness, fruit notes on mango and exotic fruits, licorice. Dark notes on the finish with still resinous bitterness, nice.
On tap at Paris Beer Week 3-- Pours deep dark brown with thin brown head. Nose is roasty. Aromas roasted malts, chocolate, quite sweet. Low carbonation, full body. Long sweet and roasty finish.
.On tap (Paris beer week). Color : nice dark ale, with brown white head. Nose : honey / roasted malt. Taste : coffee and vanilla. Low bitterness. Medium texture.

On tap on Hanging bat, Edinburgh. Pours brown color, beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, citrusy hops, raisins, cocoa. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, cocoa, roasted malt, chocolate, citrusy hops, raisins.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; drinked from the fridge.

One of the best English beer IÂ’ve tryed so far : the colour is a wonderful deep dark black one, with a brown head. The aroma is overhelmed by the hop and caramel.
The taste is, well, very hoppy with the characteristics of a stout in the same time.

Woaw.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2016 Couleur noire, lÃ©gÃ¨re mousse beige. Nez cafÃ©, grain de cafÃ©, note chocolat avec houblon et genevrier. Gout maltÃ© chocolatÃ©, cafÃ©, assez sec, avec amertume grillÃ©e et genevrier. Bon corps. Fin longue amere sur le grillÃ© et fort genevrier, reglisse, Bref une bonne black ipa
Donker bruin zwart bier met een kleine beige schuim kraag. Ruikt hop, geroosterd, koffie. Smaakt geroosterd, chocolade, koffie, hop.
Chocolade bruine, bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig hop mout, drop. Smaakt bitterzoet, fruitig, koffie.
Onder het spoor bij ubrew. Mooi donker, prima schuim. Ruikt lekker hoppig. Wel zwaarder, Black ipa richting impy of andersom?
Gran bere figlioli, direi che la bottiglia da 33, mi Ã¨ durata pochi minuti. Profumata, equilibrata e una beva spaziale...
Big, meaty BIPA here. Buckets of thick, spiky, resinous, piney hops with an assertive roasted body. Thick and oily, sweet, roasty, bitter. Lovely.

Draft @ Le Zytho, Bordeaux. Deep black body, this small brownish head. Aroma of citrus, orange, caramel, some apricot and exotic fruits notes. Flavours of first orange and citrus then comes caramel, chocolate, roasted malt, alcohol fusel and licorice. The licorise becomes very powerful in the finish and stays a long time. Strong bitterness too. Thick body and medium carbo. Superbe.

Deep black with red hue. Subtle caramel nose with some piney hops. Good smooth mouthfeel, toffee espresso taste with a big bitter finish (more pine). An easy drinking RIS.

Rated by BrewTom

Pours black with a finger of tan head. Aroma of citrus, coffee, roasted malt. Taste is citrusy and pine bitter with light chocolate and coffee notes, mellow bitter finish with light balancing sweetness. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
Super looking whith large tan head that drops down alcohol very much in the foreground loads of one resinous mouthfeel.

Ale House, Chelmsford. 

Black IPA stuff. Smooth, chocolate, nice bitterness, good balance and drinkability. A good effort from Weird Beard.
Tap at Piwoteka, about year ago. Great aroma of fruity and pine hops and notes of roasty cocoa.
Almost black pour with thick tan head. Aroma is roast, cocoa and coffee; taste is meaty, cocoa, and a good bit of pine bitterness
Oersoep festival. Zomerkwartier, Nijmegen. Zwaar gebrand en erg zacht in de mond. Maar hoooo wat een hoppen! Bittere mofo. Backlog from 2015/08/29.

Flaska frÃ¥n Ale by Mail. Smak och doft av mycket humle, choklad, grapefrukt, tallskott, resin, citrus. Riktigt god svart IPA, rund och oljig, fruktig och frisk med bra balans och beska med smak av grapefrukt, citrusskal och tallbarr. Mer av detta tack!

33cl batch 0192 bb05/2028, UK catered by idiosynkrasie, merci mate. Orchard fruit peel forward nose, candied gooseberry, Black IPA style, before malty ImpStout sugars and chocolats and overclocked gin/jenever waft through, somewhat spoiling the fruity freshness. About the same in taste on a thinner & drier palate than anticipated, counterbalanced by hop-derived green grapiness and powdery chocolate and roast. Crossover that did not entirely cater to my tastes.

Large beige head dark brown pour soft medium carbonation aromas pine floral caramel roast malt vanilla chocolate the flavours rich chocolate creaminess floral richness caramel toasted touch stone fruit citrus mandarin apricot grapefruit cumquat tastes done to the dark side fermented demented different and good the finish good intense tastes of toast and roast malts rich hops a well made Black IPA

Bottle sample at a tasting at ArielÂ’s place. Thanks Tom L. 9.4% abv. Muddy brown-black with a beige head. Hoppy and a little roasty aroma, roasty, bitter and dry mouthfeel. Full body, fizzy. dry finish. a little ink.
Fantastic Beer - I loved it! A brilliant head, great colour and as far as I am concerned one of the best Black IPAs there is.

Mooi zwart bier met een fraaie cremekleurige schuimkraag. Aromas van hop, geroosterde mout, chocola, fruit, klein beetje koffie en drop. Dit komt ook in de smaak naar voren. De smaken zijn mooi in balans met een hoofdrol voor de hop. Een mooie en complexe black IPA.

Flaska frÃ¥n Ale by Mail. En riktigt maffaig svart dubbel-IPA fullpackad med humle. KÃ¤nns som ett koncentrat av en svart-IPA, allt Ã¤r intensivare och tajtare utan att balansen gÃ¥r fÃ¶rlorad. Stor stabil kropp som inte Ã¤r fÃ¶r tung eller sÃ¶t. Massor av tung oljig aromatisk humle, tallskott, resin, grape, grÃ¶n humle. Riktigt maffig.
Poured deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet berries, dark chocolate and toasted malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma.

(bottle, 33cl, 9.4% abv) Almost black coloured hue with a big and brown foamy head. Moderately roasted bitter aroma with notes of liquorice, chocolate and coffee, accompanied by resin-spicy and delicately fruity hops. Moderately roasty and hoppy bitter flavour with a delicate malty sweetness, full bodied with a smooth carbonation. Mildly roasted malty base with notes of liquorice, chocolate and a slightly fruity and resiny hoppy touch underneath; bitter-sweet, roasty malty finish with balanced fruity and resiny hops. Very tasty stuff. 14.IX.15

Bottle sample at a tasting at ArielÂ’s place. Thanks Tom L. 9.4% abv. Muddy brownish with small brownish head. Very sweet aroma with notes of milk chocolate, a bit salty and spicy, grainy and piney with hint of sourish milk. Sweet flavor with notes of roasted malt, milk chocolate, piney with some citrus, lactic and a bit alcoholic. Medium to full-bodied. Very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at ArielÂ’s place. Thanks Tom L. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of roast, chocolate, coffee, nuts, some piney hops, slightly stale. Flavor has sweet chocolate, roast, caramel, nuts, and bitter hops, piney, slightly stale. Rounded mouthfeel.

Pours dark brown almost black with a foamy cocoa head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, roasted malt. Taste is a gorgeous smooth dark chocolate that gives way to a nice bitterness and finishes with a roasted malt after taste.

From tap at Stoom, Nijmegen. Aroma of roasted malt, pine, fruity notes, citrus, dark chocolate, coffee, hops. Flavour is light sweet and rather bitter. Body is thick and full. A great roasty Black IPA.

From Oersoep Craft Beer Festival, Nijmegen. 
Dark brown bear with a small beige head
Tastes like caramel, chocolate, liquorice, fruity and grapefruit.
Good beer.

Bottle, thnx to Zer0. Pours very dark brown beer with a small beige head on top. Aroma has roasted malts, big molasses and light citric hops. Very nice, full aroma. Flavour is nice bittersweet, loads of licorice, light grapefruit fruitiness, awesome balance. Great stuff.

Bottle shared thanks to Zer0. Pours dark brown with a big dark tan head. Aroma of grassy hops, roast, caramel, licorice, dark fruits and toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle from a corner shop. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - dark chocolate and Jamaica cake. Sweet spices. 
Taste - liquorice and molasses. Booze and wood. 
Palate - full bodied with a big tangy texture and a long dry tangy finish. 
Overall - good digestif, rich and complex if a bit gnarly.

330 ml bottled Nov 14, from Ales by Mail.
Dark brown body, with some red reflections and a big, creamy, moderately lacing, beige head.
Aroma of grapefruit, pine, resin, coffee, dark chocolate, some liquorice.
Wonderful, smooth taste of coffee, cocoa, some ash, liquorice, citrus, pine, resin, tropical fruits.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, citric, with coffee, cocoa, slight liquorice, various subtle fruits, slight alcohol warmth.

Very tasty! Especially the flavour is perfectly balanced and really smooth. Alcohol is almost completely hidden. One of the very best BIPAs IÂ’ve had so far!
Near perfect black IPA. Not fresh enough though. Well rounded and amaxin aroma and mouth feel.

Bottle from Ales By Mail. Batch 133. Pours pitch black with a big creamy tanned head. Aroma of coffee, dark bitter chocolate and some nice liquorice.Smooth & creamy mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet malty, some vanilla mixed with liquorice, weak roasty ash and malts, delicious brew.

33 cl bottle @ One Pint Pub. Batch #0133: Bottled 11/2014, BBE 11/2017. Aroma has resin, pine needles and licoricey malt. Also hints of ash & coffee. Flavour has somewhat salty licorice, coffee, some hops and mild herbal tones. A bit too salty - even medicine-like. But not bad.

9,2%ABV. Imperial Stout style dark ale

Bold malty mouthful in the style of an Imperial stout. Strongly alcoholic. Pronounced hops in the finish.

Malt balanced.

You really need to let this rest for a bit on the palate for the other beautiful subtle flavors to bloom, there are some piney hops, honey plums. fresh dates.

(Keg at KittyÂ’s, 20150517) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had liquorice, dark chocolate and burnt malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, burnt malts, liquorice, sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was ashy, sweet and bitter. A very well done black IPA. The burnt characteristics were more than well hidde.

33cl bottle at home from Beerritz. Body is black, head is small, brownish, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is light roasty, citric, flavor is toast, spices, herbs, ash, quinine, coal. Heavy hoppy and roasty bitter. Finish is long lasting heavy hoppy and roasty bitter, alcohol is nearly hidden. Full body, thin slightly sticky texture, soft carbonation. Not too easy, very bitter, good one.

Tap at Angleterre, Helsinki. Colour is black with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, some citrus, coffee, dark chocolate, grain, bread, hops and roasted malts. Very good hoppy and bready Black IPA.

Tap at KittyÂ’s, Helsinki. Almost opaque black color, decent brownish head, lace. Aroma has citrusy hoppyness, rye and toasted notes. Medium-bodied. Bready with licorice and citrusy & herbal hoppyness. Robust. Hides ABV well. Dangerous.

330ml bottle (Vastarinen Kiiski, Helsinki, Kalakierros 2015)
Lovely chocolatey roast aroma. Blackish, tight dark tan head. Lovely roasty stout, some chocolate again, but a monster wave of zingy hops. Nicely bitter, nicely drying, in particular where hop meets burntness. Mostly not hot, but I did get an occasional waft. Great balance. Damn good hoppy stout - other brewers could learn from this.
Served in an 12 oz bottle in a tulip beer glass at Metro in Lahti Finland. . A bit to harsh of a finish. It definitely got better the warmer it got. Would drink again.

Tap @ Konttori, Tampere, Finland. Medium/strong aroma with bit bitter licorice and coffee. Black color with medium, light beige head. Strong taste with bitter malts, some licorice and hoppy dark berries. Unbalanced. Wide taste spectrum. Long hoppy aftertaste with dark berries. Strong body with medium/low carbonation. Overall decent mix of high quality black IPA and stout. Too much bitterness.

Bottle from Kris Wines, London. Pours a jet black body with a medium off-white head. Nose is pine, dark chocolate, herbs, cough medicine, coffee and hints of alcohol and licorice. Taste is dark chocolate, leather, cough medicine, licorice and hints of alcohol, grass and herbs. Full body, medium carbonation. Smooth, elegant and tasty imperial black IPA from Weird Beard, which is a new acquaintance for me. Well brewed.

tap @ Konttori
Dark brown, almost black beer with beige head. Aroma has cola, tar, pine and resin. Flavor has licorice, roasted malts, cola and resin. Palate is full with quite strong carbonation. Finish has quite strong bitterness. Aftertaste has salty licorice, cola, resin and pine. Some alcohol as well. A decent strong Black IPA.

Almost black, a head is medium and light brown. Aroma is weird mix of liquirice, bread, roastiness and coconut fat. Hops are milder and piney with notes of citrusfruits. Anyway, pleasant aroma. Taste is also nicely balanced. Roastiness, coffee, some pine needles and salt. Medium bitterness that is presented more in the end and itÂ’s long lasting with pine. Pleasant palate, smooth and almost full bodied. Quite personal beer with the great balance and smoothness.
Tap @ Konttori. Pours dark brown with a creamy beige head. Citrus,Hoppy, roasted malts aroma, dark chocolate. Roasted malts, bitter hops, dark chocolate in the flavor
Keg at Konttori, Tampere. Pours black and big brown head. Intense aroma is roasted malts, piney hops, chocolate. Flavour is roasted, sweetish, hops, liquorice. Coffee and bittersweet finish.

Black pour with a solid big creamy beige head. Nice lacing. Coffee, rich fruity, pine and grapefruit hoppy aroma. Full body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Soft carbonation with a oily texture. Coffee, chocolate, roasted, resinous and grapefruit hoppy flavor. Tasty little horny devil. Well masked alcohol.[Bottle (batch 0094) from Bottle Shop - Druid Street in London, England]

Bottle from sheffield tap. Black with a tan head and some floaty particles. Aroma is herbal with liquorice and pine needles and mint. Taste is slightly sweet and nice bitter finish (IÂ’m drinking this after a stone self righteous, so it might be more bitter than I think). Thick and oily with good lively carbonation. Enjoyed this more than s_hartshorne as it appears to have halved in price! Haha

Draught. Black in color with a creamy tan head. Roasted coffee, milk chocolate sweetness and hints of citrus fruityness in aroma. Soft and quite smooth mouthfeel. Slightly on bitter side at first tastewise, mostly perhaps some bitter chocolate here. Underneath thereÂ’s the roasted notes meeting you too. Bit of grassy bitterness and citrus fruityness as well. Later on the brew offers even more of somewhat bitter, dark chocolatey notes and some further slightly salty and ashy aspects. Nice though and the drinkability here is good. Gets better towards the end, and I do like the roasted and burnt salty aftertaste here.

[emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Black, light tan head. Soft roasty, piney, grapefruity hoppy fruity nose. Med full, soft, quite smooth mouthfeel. Pretty nice really. Roasty malts, lots of bitters, but soft, towards silky, with a slight mouthdrying bitter finish. Grapefruit, pines in flavour, some licorice roastyness.-- bb

Bottle at home thanks to olliejobbins. Black with nice full beige head, looks inviting... Lots of aromatic hops at first with resin, grapefruit, lemon rind. Nice spices going into dark chocolate and rye bread, Nutella, porridge. Bitter through your with light sweetness mid way. Alcohol is well hidden. Full bodied with very creamy feel. Nice one!

Fast schwarzes Bier mit einer ordentlichen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv hopfig, fruchitg, grasig, nur leicht rÃ¶stmalzig. Geschmack sehr fruchtig hopfig, grasig bitter, gering Kaffee und Vanille, gut!

Draft. Medium beige head atop dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, roast, some orange, light coffee, alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet, orange, roast, some grapefruit, coffee, light alcohol, alcohol warming. Medium-full body, fairly smooth.

Opaque black beer with a thin beige head and a tangy, hoppy aroma. Flavour is tangy fruit with sharp, bitter hop and a touch of malt coming through as well. ItÂ’s really well balanced as the fruit could easily have been a bit sickly if not for the other flavours to counter it a bit.
330ml bottle from Ales By Mail. Almost black, reasonable head. Leafy treacle malt aroma. Sweet treacle hop flavour. Bitter aftertaste. More imperial stout than Black IPA.

Bottle, bought @Alesbymail. Pours opaque black with a medium, staying, creamy beige head. Aroma has pine needles, citrus, plenty of fresh strawberry. Light roasted with some coffee. Medium carbonation, fine dry and very creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, roasted, chocolate, strawberries, lemon, softly vinious, resin, mild dry coffee in the finish. Lovely balanced beer.

Bottle from the brewery, pours a deep dark brown-black with a fine tan head and a big hoppy nose with lots of pine plus touches of mango, grapefruit and pineapple. Roasty malt, bright fruity hoppy bitterness, warming alcohol, notes of treacle, ash and pepper, then a dry-bitter and lightly floral finish. Lush, wonderfully integrated, and gorgeous.

Bottle at home from Blackrock cellar. Pours deep black with tan foam head. Aroma is hoppy notes, pine, spruce, grass. Under that is a coffee, chocolate undercurrent. Earth, woody notes even a leather hint. Flavour is dry mild sweetness, with a roasted milky chocolate coffee. Mild carbonation. Full luscious creamy body. Has a slight bitter dry finish. Lovely balance with a lot of complexity. Not of hint of alcohol in this. Really great black IPA.

Nicely integrated and dangerously light tasting. Pours dark brown/black with ok head and lacing. Light bitter finish. Some caramel, roast and a touch of citrus. Faint hint of licorice. Tap at Churchkey.
Draft at Churchkey. Pretty much black, beige head. Aroma of floral roast. Taste has cocoa, coffee, bitter and dry finish. Very tasty.

Bottle from Drinkstore. Deep brown, almost black, thin tan head. Chocolate, coffee, floral hops. Similar notes in the flavour profile. Lovely lush mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Roasty finish. Lovely stuff.

Aroma: intense toasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate. Appearance: black, small creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, some sweet, dry cacao. Overall: very nice Black IPA, nice aroma. Pint at The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey.

Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Greenwich. Ash brown pour with a beige head. Rich aromas of prunes, chocolate, dates, marzipan, cinnamon, licorice toffee. Exceedingly good nose. Boozy flavours of crÃ¨me caramel, toffee, licorice, ash, dark chocolate. Long alcohol warmth down the old gullet. Drier than the Sahara after a thousand year drought. Very nice indeed.

33cl, at 9.4%Vol, as Something Something Dark Side, new exclusive English brew Anno 2013, with honey, from Ales By Mail (UK), very complex bitter brew, roasted/bitter and slightly fruity/spicy/sweet, balanced, hazy, good head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Bottle. Dark brown colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, pine, coffee. Flavour is licorice, hop, pine, roasted malt, coffee. full body . Nice beer.

Backlog rating, from bottle. It pours a dark brown color with a medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee beans, cocoa powder, persimmon and pine. Taste is roasty and quite bitter with more coffee and cocoa notes and a piney hoppy kick. Medium body with good carbonation. Overall, good

Bottle, Londis, Penny Lane, Liverpool. Exited the bottle a deep dark brown colour with a smallish beige head. Pleasing nose of fruits, hop, choc and roast. Rich flavour that nicely amalgamated the hop and roast in tandem with some citrus and malts. full bodied and smooth with some booze lurking menacingly in the shadows. Quality offering, probably the best IÂ’ve tasted thus far from this stable. Props to the mashup.
Bottle. Black with tan head. Aroma is slightly vegetal, piney with coffee and a light roastiness. Taste of coffee, roast, resin. Smooth and sslightly bitter. Nice

33 cl bottle.
Pours pitch black color with a medium sized beige head. Nice roasty aroma with orange peel, some citrus, crisp hops, licorice and faint dark chocolaty notes. Very creamy, even oily palate, lots of roasted malts, salty licorice, dark chocolate and faint coffee. Very intense stuff, black and tan are in perfect union on this on. Excellent.
5526

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 Bottle Sheff tap. Black good tan head. Aroma is pine grapefruit good hoppy bitters taste same good bitter finish. Nice oily body. Wow defo not worth 14 pound per half I would rarther swill my mouth out with carling at a 14th of the price!!! The brewer actually got in touch with me about the price  said it should cost about 7-8 tops he then got in touch with Sheff tap. My friend jackafholmes has bought a bottle since and the price has halfed!! Well done weird beard!!!

If youÂ’re ever feeling down, grab your purse and take a taxi to the darker side of town, thatÂ’s where IÂ’ll be, and I will wait for you and lead you through the dance floor up to the DJ booth. You know what to ask for. You know what to ask for..

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 Bottle from The Beerhive. Black body with a thick, lasting beige head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of aniseed, pine, black cherry, treacle, caramel and coffee beans. Flavour of wood, blood orange, filter coffee, grapefruit, honey, rich dark chocolate and cranberry. Peppery finish. Dangerously drinkable for its strength (IÂ’ve had bottles at 9.4% and 9.2% ABV). Medium body with a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Light carbonation. Every sip brings a new layer of complexity - itÂ’s juicy, bitter, rich and sweet all at the same time. Sensational.

Bottle.Black with a small head.Hops dominate with floral and other flavours such as liquorice and chocolate in the background. Where do they get all these flavours from? An excellent beer that ids dangerously easy to drink.

Bottle. A clear looking dark brown beer with a small, dense, light tan head. The aroma has some sweet licorice, roasted malts and coffee, with piney hops and a citrus peel touch. A good dash of licorice in the flavor too, with some cough syrup, roasted malts and coffee. Pine cones, resins and a hoppy bitterness in the flavor. Full body and a nice carbonation level. Lasting roasted and hop-bitter finish. Too malty forward for a black IPA I think, but still nice and tasteful. 140808

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, citrus, orange, grape, alcohol, and licorice. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long chocolate, orange, warm and licorice finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, some fruitiness, citrus and floral notes. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, licorice, citrus, peach, some roasted notes and some bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.
Boozy soft fruit on the nose, thick luxurious mouth feel. Supremely well balance, with loads going on in itÂ’s flavour.fantastic beer.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Weird Beard Something Something Darkside ].Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, pine, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, malt bitter, dry, hoppy, pine. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140705]
Black of color with a brown head. An aroma of citrus, lemon, coffee, liqurice and fresh. A flavor of roasted malt, liqurice, cold coffee, lemon, citrus and citrus peel.

Bottle, 9%.Very dark brown with medium beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, hop and earthy. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, earthy, coffee, medium sweet, liquorice, notes of alcohol and bitter.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Almost black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt, coffee and moderate hoppy - pine. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 050714
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, roast malt, chocolate and has a nice bitter finish.
Bottle at CraigÂ’s. Pours black with a thick biege head. Big pine hop aromas, light roast and toffee. Taste is creamy hop bitter, more light coffee. Oily texture, bitter finish. Good.

Tap. Dark brown close to black with a small good lacing creamy light brown head. Hoppy start, citrus and floral, light wooden before turning malty with dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted notes. Medium/full body, oily/creamy texture, soft carbonation, medium sweet and medium/heavy bitter. Long dry and bitter finish.

Muddy dark brown, decent wedge of a beige head. Caramelatte butterscotch head. Neat rich sweet roast with a jarring unsyndicated bitterness. Creamy with a soft oily mouthfeel. Light tang on the finish. Bottle, LetÂ’s Go Digita Tasting

bottle at home .. deep black ... small tan head ... soft sweet roast ... dark malts ... soft toffee fruits ... sweet toffee dark malts .. very sweet roast ... soft toffee roast .. soft coffee .. fruits ... floral fruits .. real nice
Bottle at CraigÂ’s. Pours black, smoky, meaty, chocolate nose, taste is rich chocolate, smoky, dry, bitter, juicy.

Bottle from The Cellar, Chester. Pours completely black with a one finger thick tan head. Aroma is cherry, chocolate and malt. Taste is liquorice, cherry and dark chocolate. Low carbonation and oily mouthfeel. Good beer!

Bottle from Deliciously Different. Dark brown/black colour. Sweet nose of marshmellow and creme brulee with some peppery notes and citrus. Very strange combination. Sweet taste with bitter aftertaste. Not bad but this beer is a bit a mess.
Bottle from Metro Wines, Syston, Leics. strangely compelling. The nature of this mashup is hard for the tongue to pin down. Malty, with a tangy, boozy finish. Enjoyable, breathy.

Bottle @ Kings Day Tasting 2014 shared with Dutchdrebus. Opaque black color, small light brown head. Smell and taste malts, hops, lightly roasty, light to moderately hoppy, subtly bitter. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle @ KDT14 @ benzai. Very dark brown colour with a medium sized beige to light brown head. Smells roasty, chocolate, weird. Tastes roasty, chocolate, coffee, slighly hoppy. Medium body, soft to medium carbo.

Bottle from Beermoth, Manchester. Nearly black. Thin, tight, tan coloured head. Liquorice. Blackcurrant. Carbolic soap. Taste is roast dryness. Big bitterness. Perfectly conditioned. Everything is ticked. Lovely.

Bottle. Very dark brown with a beige foam. Aromas are cocoa nibs with smoky coffee and dark berries. Pithy grapefruit and floral pine with creamy oak barrel. Toffee with earthy coal and peppery alcohol. Flavours are earthy roast coffee with dark berries and bittersweet pine and light grapefruit pithiness. Dark chocolate bitterness with a woody, boozy finish. Very good.

My 2800th rating. 33cl bottle. Bottled Nov 13. Black color, lasting brown head. Heavy roasted aroma, coffee, chocolate but unfortunately also off notes, some vinegar present, both in aroma and flavor. More disturbing in the aroma. As it gets warmer the off notes in the flavor actually disappears almost completely. Dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, vinegar. Smooth, dry hoppy finish. Too bad about the aroma.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail
Bottled Nov 2013 - Pours dark brown, almost black with a smooth white head. Aroma of roasty malts, licorice, sweet syrup, fruity and grassy hops, citrus. Taste is smooth, roasty and salty with notes of licorice, grassy hops, fruits and citrus. Finish is smooth, stingy and salty with loads of licorice, fruits, roastiness, grass and citrus. Quite heavy but very well balanced imperial black IPA.

Draught at Craft Beer Clerkenwell.
Dark brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Light roasted aroma of dark chocolate, hops and licorice.
Light roasted flavour of caramel, licorice and hops with notes of dark chocolate.
Roasted and hoppy finish.

330ml bottle. Darkest brown colour with average, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Dark malty aroma, hints of coffee, grassy and herbal hoppy overtones, a peppery green onion touch. Taste is bitter hoppy, dry, roasty dark malty basis, notes of coffee, a salty touch of liquorice. Sober, precise, concentrated, very well balanced. Good!
Bottle at home, 5th April 14. Smells of burnt caramel, molasses. Taste is creme brÃ»lÃ©e, burnt sugar, molasses some bitterness. Strange but quite nice.

On tap at The Craft Clerkenwell. Well itÂ’s big in terms of punch. No heat just a little sting on the finish. But you know the alcohol is there. Black as night beer no real head. Dark chocolate on the aroma. Surely this is an imperial stout. I mean this has nothing in the same terms as an ipa. Touch of sour on the aroma. Some hop on the finish. For me itÂ’s a slightly watery bodied slightly failed impy stout.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a pitch black colour with a tan head. Lovely aroma of pine, juicy fruitiness, dark chocolate, mild caramel sweetness and licorice. Rich and thick flavour of roastiness, strong piney bitterness, floral notes, licorice and tangy grapefruit. Some spicy herbal notes from the hops as well. Full bodied and thick mouthfeel with very smooth carbonation. Some alcohol warmth. Excellent.

Draft at Pigs Ear 2013 - London. Pours black with a frothy tan cap. Good dark malt aroma with accents of burnt pine, coconut and grapefruit. Medium sweet flavor with a bit of alcohol punch, dry cocoa, dried citrus fruits, dirt. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Good condition. Finishes with charred dark malts, dark fruits, warming alcohol and torched wood. A manly black IPA, this.

Keg at Brewdog Camden, London. A black coloured pour with virtually no head to speak of. Hoppy, roasty, pine aroma. Tastes similar, slightly hoppy, roasty, pine, some citrus fruit with a bitter ending. Pretty good but I was expecting something much better.

Bottle at home from ales by mail rich slightly creamy with resinous Piney hops. Opaque dark brown with dense tan head. Rich chocolatey malt, pithy citrus hops and dry roasty chocolatey malt giving a long dry yet fruity finish. All the best bits of iipa and irs.
330ml bottle. Pours jet black with a large head. Aroma is strong, sweet pine. Taste has lots of piney hops and a touch of roast. Bit of pineapple on the finish.

Tap at BD shepherds bush. Pours dark brown with no head. Nose is quite grassy and pine forward with shortbread and light liquorice. Taste is a little thin with heavy pine and orange zest. Quite citrus fruit focused stuff. Slightly bitter but too thin. Doesn't have a great deal going for it and no depth. Just ok
Very nice. A big bad, bold black IPA which is closer to the super charged stout side of things, with a bitter roasty edge rolling around a big pillow of hops.
Cask at The Sheffield Tap; dark black pour with thin tan head, pine aroma, taste has pine with some earthiness along with dark fruits and some roasted malts and chocolate.

Bottle at home sourced from sourced market. Opaque black / dark caramel with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is cream caramel, coffee, soft roast and piney citrus hop. Flavour is big bold caramel, biting roast, pine hop and solid assertive grapefruit bitterness. Palate is big full sticky creamy. Finish carried a boozy kick and soft slightly astringent roast. Tasty big black ipa.
Bottle from Kris Wines. Dark black oily colour, low carbonation. A real assault of flavour, dark roasty tar malts and some fresh herbal medicinal bitter hops. Boozy too. ItÂ’s good.

Bottle from Jacks, Goring-on-Thames, Oxon, Tuesday 21st January 2014 consumed at Bath Marina Campsite, Saturday 25th January in Frank (camper)   Pours black with creamy light beige head, some film. Hoppy roasty beer but wonderfully smooth. Some fresh green hop juice runs through the nose. Lovely roasty hoppy balance, warming indulgent and yet hoppy, its great. Soft in the mouth, strong, very strong but damn good, loving the hops.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8

Bottled on 11/2013. Pours a very dark brown/black with a light tan head. Aroma has hints of tangerine, coffee, veg, mango, toffee... Medium body, medium carbonation. Fruity to start with orange and trop fruit, then some bitter coffee, licorice, treacle, burnt sugar, dark choc. It finishes with a lightly fruity dark choc/espresso bitterness. There's some boozy warmth too. It's good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle - 9% bottled Nov 2013, into a tulip. Black with a decent foamy head. Smell - cheesy hops, mint with some ash. Body is medium, not really foamy, low carbonation. Taste - tangy citrus fruits, cheese, mint, lime, some smoke in the slightly astringent finish. IÂ’m normally put off by cheesiness in beers, but itÂ’s not too offensive here - if anything the hops make the beer light, drinkable and palate cleansing. Good.

6th December 2013Pigs Ear. Sold to me as a Double Black IPA. Opaque dark brown - black beer. Small bubbly tan head. Smooth dark malt and a little dark chocolate. Light tangy dark fruit underneath. Hops are spicy and piney and also carrying a little citrus. Finishes smooth with more hop spice that carries on well in to the aftertaste. Very nicely done (alleged) blend.

Gravity dispense at Pigs Ear Â’13, 05/12/13.
Off black with a moderate tan covering that settles to form a swirl.
Nose carries a boozey blast, pine waftings, earthy tropicals, grapefruit, cocoa, bitter roast.
Taste comprises bitter grapefruit, nice roasted tones, burnt toffee, earthy, tangy hop presence, light pine bite.
Medium bodied with a kick, fine carbonation, booze laced closure.
Decent ramped up CDA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask gravity at Pigs Ear 2013. It pours near black with a small tan head. The nose is piney, resin, earth, light smoke and orange peel. The taste is rich roast, varnish, pine, resin, liquorice, toast, spice and warming alcohol with a dry, bitter finish. Medium-full body and soft carbonation. Nice full flavour and good bitterness. Tasty.
